intro: Draba araucana, commonly known as the Andean whitlow, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded seeds. Draba araucana is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
